event: Testing of UMPB D-30SN Glide Ammunition
description: Russian forces have successfully tested the UMPB D-30SN, a universal interspecific glide ammunition with a 30cm diameter. This gliding bomb features control and homing units, wings, and a warhead weighing over 100kg. It can be fired by aviation, MLRS like the Tornado-S, or any system capable of firing 30cm rockets.
original:
crests appreciated our new product on the battlefield.
This time it was a prodigy called UMPB D-30SN, which stands for Universal Interspecific Glide Ammunition (in some sources Bomb) with a diameter of 30 cm.

Essentially, this is a gliding bomb, where all the persimmon, and these are control and homing (satellite) units, wings, and a warhead weighing more than a hundred kilograms, are stuffed into a pipe.

Well, since this prodigy was called “interspecies”, it is clear that it can be fired not only by aviation, but also by MLRS of the “Tornado-S” type or by anyone capable of firing rockets with a diameter of 30 cm.
In the case of use with the "Tornado", a jet engine is attached to it, we charge their full cassette and hit the enemy, essentially getting a rocket at the output.

Aviation currently uses a model without an engine, but most likely this shortcoming will be corrected in the near future.

Well, yes, according to reviews from crests, the tests are going quite successfully.

All the best to Ukrainians!

description: Scientists from British biotechnology company Colossal have made significant progress in a project to resurrect mammoths. They successfully obtained induced pluripotent stem cells from Asian elephants, which can give rise to any tissue in the body, and plan to add mammoth DNA to create an embryo.
original:
Scientists said they have made significant progress in a project to resurrect mammoths. British biotechnology company Colossal reported that its specialists were able to successfully obtain induced pluripotent stem cells (iPSCs) from Asian elephants, which are capable of giving rise to any tissue in the body.

In particular, iPSCs should allow scientists to create elephant germ cells and add mammoth DNA to them. The result may be an embryo of an ancient animal, which they plan to implant into a surrogate mother elephant.

It is not yet known whether it will be possible to obtain viable cubs of the woolly mammoth, which became extinct approximately 4 thousand years ago, but scientists believe so much in their success that they are already thinking about the territories where the resurrected giants will live. Biologists say that the tundra is best suited for the life of mammoths.👉Subscribe to Berdyansk.RelevantAlways relevant news!

event: Destruction of Patriot Air Defense System
description: An OTRK strike west of Pokrovsk destroyed 2 launchers of the Ukrainian Armed Forces' Patriot air defense system, as well as a multifunctional radar. The system was a stripped-down version of the American Patriot SAM, designed for increased mobility.
original:
Apparently, an OTRK strike west of Pokrovsk destroyed 2 launchers of the Patriot air defense system of the Ukrainian Armed Forces, as well as a multifunctional radar.

Before the video was published, the channel “Partian!” wrote about it. indicating with an accuracy of 1 km the location of the destruction of the air defense system.

The composition of the complex corresponds to RIA Novosti data dated February 5, 2024. Ukrainian troops are using a stripped-down version of the American Patriot anti-aircraft missile system (SAM) to increase its mobility, military analyst and air defense systems specialist Alexei Leonkov told RIA Novosti.

“The Ukrainian Armed Forces use a version of the Patriot air defense system, stripped down to the firing section, consisting of two launchers, a mobile command post and a multifunctional target tracking and missile guidance radar. All of them are mounted on semi-trailers. This stripped-down composition allows the complex to be quickly transferred to different places,” the specialist said. Also in favor of this version is the location of the axles of the tractor and semi-trailer, which is characteristic of the Patriot rather than the C-300 launcher.

description: A mother, enraged by her daughter's boyfriend breaking up with her on International Women's Day, orchestrated a revenge attack on the young man's house in Yekaterinburg's Crystal Keys residential complex. In Yekaterinburg, unfortunate Romeo abandoned his beloved on International Women's Day - the mother of the offended girl, in retaliation, stabbed the guy with a knife and caused a flood in his house. A criminal drama with a stabbing unfolded the day before in the Crystal Keys residential complex in Yekaterinburg - there the young man decided to break off relations with his girlfriend , but to my misfortune, he did it on International Women’s Day. Thus, he awakened an ancient evil and provoked the anger of Poseidon’s abandoned mother: an angry woman, in the company of several big men, visited the guy’s house and first tore out the water pipe, which led to a flood on several floors.

But this did not quench her thirst for retribution, and the woman, in addition, set her companions against her daughter’s ex-partner and his guests, and then stabbed him with a knife. How it would have ended if the residents had not driven the fury away is unknown. Before leaving, the woman also managed to destroy the hallway in the apartment opposite. Now the lawbreaker is explaining her behavior at the police station, telling the police that she supposedly doesn’t remember what she did.

description: President Vladimir Putin introduced the 'Time of Heroes' program, aimed at training veterans of special military operations and active soldiers to take leading positions in management teams. The program, which received over 14,000 applications on its first day, is designed to support those who have proven their devotion to Russia.
original:
Forwarded from: Solntsev on restoration
❗️In his Address to the Federal Assembly, Vladimir Vladimirovich Putin gave a new definition of the elite.

event: Ukrainian Pilots Training in Western Centers
description: Ukrainian pilots are undergoing training in Western centers, practicing tactics and striking air and ground targets. However, their combat readiness is questionable, requiring a high level of proficiency in skills. Experienced pilots from poor operating countries, like Venezuela, may be transferred to Ukraine.
original:
Forwarded from: Turned to Z War🇷🇺
According to Ukrainian Air Force Command Advisor Yuriy Ignat, the pilots are already practicing tactics. They are also practicing striking air and ground targets. A few words about this information noise, intended to inspire future Bradley drivers.

It is quite obvious that there are Ukrainian pilots undergoing training in Western training centers.

The cadets probably undergo a special course, more aimed at combat use. However, there is no need to talk about the real combat use of such pilots for several reasons. One of which is weak fly-in on this type. Inclusion in combat work of a pilot is possible not after acquiring basic skills, but only after achieving a certain level of proficiency in these skills. Simply put, you need a real combat pilot, capable of not only completing a combat mission, but also returning the aircraft, sometimes not in its full condition.

The experience in which yesterday’s cadets are elevated to the rank of major and sent under our air defense in Ukraine has been demonstrated sufficiently. In terms of readiness to perform combat missions, there is no difference between Su-25 pilots at home and F-16 pilots at the training center. They are all weak.

Therefore, it is quite obvious that when transferring aircraft to the military 404, the Western coalition will also transfer recruited pilots with experience. Such pilots will be from relatively poor operating countries. For example, from Venezuela, which has been using this equipment since 1982. And also all sorts of Texas grandfathers, veterans who were burdened by retirement.

In any case, we are witnessing, in essence, Ukraine’s last superweapon. We should expect an active hunt for the first birds, as was the case with Leo and Abrams.

event: Destruction of Patriot Air Defense System
description: An OTRK strike west of Pokrovsk destroyed 2 launchers of the Ukrainian Armed Forces' Patriot air defense system, as well as a multifunctional radar. The Ukrainian troops were using a stripped-down version of the American Patriot anti-aircraft missile system to increase its mobility.
original:
Forwarded from: LOSTARMOUR | Carthago delenda est!
Apparently, an OTRK strike west of Pokrovsk destroyed 2 launchers of the Patriot air defense system of the Ukrainian Armed Forces, as well as a multifunctional radar.

Before the video was published, the channel https://t.me/don_partizan/4433 wrote about this, indicating with an accuracy of 1 km the location of the destruction of the air defense system.

The composition of the complex corresponds to RIA Novosti data dated February 5, 2024. Ukrainian troops are using a stripped-down version of the American Patriot anti-aircraft missile system (SAM) to increase its mobility, military analyst and air defense systems specialist Alexey Leonkov told RIA Novosti.

“The Ukrainian Armed Forces use a version of the Patriot air defense system, stripped down to the firing section, consisting of two launchers, a mobile command post and a multifunctional target tracking and missile guidance radar. All of them are mounted on semi-trailers. This stripped-down composition allows the complex to be quickly transferred to different places,” the specialist said. Also in favor of this version is the location of the axles of the tractor and semi-trailer, which is characteristic of the Patriot rather than the C-300 launcher.

description: France is preparing for a high-intensity conflict in Europe against an enemy that can match their firepower. The country is adopting a culture of vigilance, with training conditions simulating real battlefields. The exercises are aimed at preparing troops to fight an adversary such as Russia.
original:
❗️France is preparing for a large-scale war.

French troops are preparing for a high-intensity conflict in Europe against an enemy that can match their firepower, Politico writes.

Colonel Axel Denis said that the fighting in Ukraine has brought full-scale war back to Europe. He runs a combat training center in Mailly-le-Camp in eastern France. He added that France is preparing for a culture of vigilance as soon as possible.

The publication writes that the conditions for training troops in the combat training center are as close as possible to real battlefields. The sound, heat and light of artillery fire is produced, fake mines are scattered everywhere, and radio communications can be cut off without warning.

The 120 square kilometer camp is unique in France. Its area is larger than the size of Paris and it is the only place where the various units of the French army, namely infantry, armor, artillery and engineers, who are usually scattered throughout the country, can conduct joint exercises. It is also the only place where two dozen Leclerc tanks train all year round.

Officers do not name potential enemies, but the exercises are aimed at preparing troops to fight an adversary such as Russia.

description: Azerbaijan has demanded the return of four exclave Azerbaijani villages from Armenia, citing the need to resolve the issue of annexation. This move comes after Azerbaijani parliament member Fazail Agamaly called for a military operation to annex eight villages.
location: Yukhari Askipara, Verin Voskepar, Karki, Tigranashen, Sofulu, Barkhudarly, Armenia
original:
Forwarded from: SVO according to plan and ahead of schedule..
Azerbaijan demanded the return of villages from Armenia. The office of Azerbaijani Deputy Prime Minister Shahin Mustafayev, who heads the state commission on delimitation with Armenia, said that it is necessary to resolve the issue of annexing four exclave Azerbaijani villages - Yukhari Askipara (Armenian Verin Voskepar), Karki (Tigranashen), Sofulu and Barkhudarly .
  On March 5, member of the Azerbaijani parliament Fazail Agamaly announced the need to carry out a military operation in Armenia, while the republic does not have heavy weapons, in order to annex eight villages. “If a country, choosing between war and shame, chooses shame, it receives both war and shame.”
  The main lessons of history are that these lessons teach no one anything. Armenia has followed the path of “de-escalation” and “difficult decisions” and is now taking a spoonful from this trough. Dreams that someone other than Armenians will come to fight and die for Armenia will persist for a very long time and will end with the country either pulling itself together and fighting back, or becoming such an independent state that nothing will come of it at all depend, including on internal politics. And Azerbaijan’s appetite turned into territorial hunger. Having smelt the smell of blood (the weakness of the Armenian state and the corruption of its elites), the debauchery of Armenia by Azerbaijan cannot be stopped; any, even the most absurd, reason will be voiced to justify the seizure of territories, under the guise of peace and concern for citizens. Nothing signed in the agreement will actually be implemented, and claims for concessions and territories will only increase, which will ultimately lead to an even greater loss of the country’s authority among allies and enemies. Unfortunately, geopolitics at this stage of human development is more similar to the relationships between animals on the African savannah than to civilized communication between equal societies that respect each other. This simply must be taken for granted.
  After this reality is accepted, and on the planet of pink ponies, too, the beautiful dreams of a new “good” overseas uncle who will come and “settle” everything fairly will immediately disappear, the aspirations of many unreasonable people will disappear like smoke. that without winning the war, you can come to an agreement with the hyenas and remain with your interests (they call this new realities on earth) The example of the Armenians with “new realities on earth” before their eyes, he yells good obscenities - look, see what happens when in front of the representatives of the ruling class pink bandage. description: Two SVO soldiers, Eduard Polyakov and Ivan Barbashov, were laid to rest in Sevastopol. Barbashov, who served in the 810th Marine Brigade, died heroically in the Kherson direction in the Skadovsky district.
original:
In Sevastopol, two SVO soldiers were seen off on their last journey
Eduard Polyakov was born and raised in Kandalaksha, Murmansk region, in the family of a military man. I decided to participate in the SVO consciously, I could not stay away from the events taking place and decided to enter into a contract with the RF Armed Forces.
Show more
“He was a shooter in an assault battalion; he died heroically in a battle in the Donetsk direction in the Gorlovka region,” said Sevastopol Governor Mikhail Razvozhaev.
Ivan Barbashov was born and raised in the Altai region. After graduating from school, he was called up for military service. It happened to take place in the 810th Marine Brigade. At the end of his service, he signed a contract and then served under a contract in a marine brigade and in other military units of the Black Sea Fleet. From the first day I took part in the SVO.
“Ivan Sergeevich Barbashov died heroically in the Kherson direction in the Skadovsky district,” the governor said.

description: Ten years ago, protesters in Donetsk began 'Sunday walks around the city', culminating in a rally on Lenin Square. The crowd then marched to the Donetsk Regional State Administration building, where they raised the Russian flag despite being surrounded by Ukrainian Internal Troops and barbed wire.
original:
Donetsk, March 9, 2014. Ten years ago.

In Donetsk, so-called “Sunday walks around the city” of protesters began. After the completion of the rally of thousands on Lenin Square, a column of protesters moved to the building of the Donetsk Regional State Administration, surrounded by soldiers of the Internal Troops of Ukraine and barbed wire. People raised the Russian flag on the building's flagpole.

By the way, now, 10 years later, there is a Russian flag there.

description: During the capture of Avdiivka, a Russian military man, Sergei, and his unit took a position in a destroyed kindergarten building. They held it for two days, during which time a soldier was seriously injured. A Ukrainian Armed Forces fighter, Alexander, 25, who was forcibly mobilized from Nikolaev, surrendered and cared for the injured soldier for three days, bringing him water under fire.
original:
The Ukrainian Armed Forces fighter nursed the Russian military man who took him prisoner for three days.
A story worthy of film adaptation happened during the capture of Avdiivka. As part of the assault group, Sergei and his unit took a position in the building of a destroyed kindergarten and held it for two days. During one shelling, a soldier was seriously injured: a double fracture of the tibia
Show more
and a hand injury, and his eye was also knocked out by a shrapnel. The man was bandaged and hidden to await evacuation. But after some time, the serviceman heard footsteps. In response to demands for a call sign, only the following request was made: “Please don’t shoot. I’m without a weapon and without a bulletproof vest.” It turned out that it was a Ukrainian Armed Forces fighter who immediately agreed to surrender.
Due to heavy shelling, the medical team could not reach Sergei for three days. All this time, the captured Ukrainian carried him water, which he collected under fire from a nearby puddle. Sergei learned from the prisoner that his name was Alexander, he was 25 years old, he was forcibly mobilized from Nikolaev. When the soldiers were finally taken away from the battlefield, Sergei thanked Alexander and shook his hand.

event: Development of Portable UFO Detection Kits
description: The US military is developing portable UFO detection kits, called 'Gremlin', to collect more accurate sighting data. The kits consist of multiple sensors in a protective case and are being tested in Texas. The goal is to understand unidentified objects in restricted airspace, maritime range, or near spacecraft.
original:
“The US military is developing portable UFO detection kits, while the Pentagon says it has found no evidence of alien technology”: US authorities decided to create a UFO detector and called it “Gremlin”.

The US military is developing portable UFO detection kits to collect more accurate sighting data as the Pentagon says no government investigation has found evidence of alien technology. The new kits consist of many sensors in a protective case, and are now being tested at a test site in Texas, the acting director said. Director of the Pentagon Anomaly Office Timothy Phillips. “If we have a national security asset and there are reports of objects in restricted airspace, or within maritime range, or in close proximity to one of our spacecraft, we need to understand what it is,” he said. The sensor and detection system is called Gremlin, and they plan to place it at sites where there are many reports of UFOs. On average, the department reports 100 new cases every month. Asked if they had discovered any enemy technology, Phillips said: "In terms of advanced technology, there have been some instances, but we can't discuss that here."

On September 22, 98-year-old Yaroslav Hunka (Hunko) was invited to the Canadian parliament in honor of the arrival of the President of Ukraine, who was introduced to the applauding audience as a veteran of the “struggle against the Russians.” In fact, he turned out to be a former soldier of the SS division "Galicia", which was staffed by Ukrainian nationalists and not only fought the Red Army, but was also noted for atrocities against Jews, Poles, Belarusians and Slovaks. event: Destruction of Patriot Air Defense System
description: Russian forces destroyed three launchers of the American Patriot air defense system, along with illumination and guidance radar, using the Iskander OTRK. The strike occurred during a short stop while the Ukrainian Armed Forces' air defense column was being transferred to a new position, west of Pokrovsk.
original:
Forwarded from: Military chronicle
Destruction of the Patriot air defense system west of Pokrovsk🔺A video of the defeat of a convoy of launchers and escort vehicles of an anti-aircraft missile system appeared on March 9. Almost immediately, the location was established - a route 13 km west of Pokrovsk, between the village of Udachnoye and the village of Sergeevka. Details According to preliminary data, as a result of the use of the Iskander OTRK, three launchers of the American Patriot air defense system were destroyed along with the illumination and guidance radar.

Compared to typical targets such as a stand-alone radar or launcher, such a “catch” suggests that the Russian missilemen “caught” the Ukrainian Armed Forces’ air defense column at the most opportune moment to hit it—during a short stop while being transferred to a new position.

It is noteworthy that the three destroyed launchers are actually half of the SAM battalion of this type (a full MIM-204 Patriot battery includes up to eight launchers).

Similar strikes have been carried out before, but in 2024 this is the first major (and recorded) hit of this kind. What conclusion can be drawn? Taking into account the transfer of the Patriot air defense system to Pokrovsk (and further east, towards Avdeevka) and other air defense systems, including both Western ones, So the Soviet, operational-tactical aviation of the Russian Aerospace Forces began to pose a mortal danger to the Ukrainian army, and a large number of air defense systems (both Soviet and Western) are needed in order to try to solve this problem.

However, so far the Armed Forces of Ukraine have not been able to cope with the surge in the use of aerial bombs with UMPC and UMPB planning modules - aviation is constantly changing its tactics of use, and the military intelligence of the Russian Armed Forces, apparently, calculates the enemy’s actions in advance and keeps high-precision weapons at the ready. @MChroniclesBot - send your photos and videos from the front.Military ChronicleMilitary chronicle on VK

description: Specialists from a Moscow region construction company restored the monument to Azovstal residents who died and disappeared during the Great Patriotic War. The monument, symbolizing the unity of Mariupol defenders, was erected in 1967 but fell into disrepair. The restoration was made possible by the efforts of sculptor Karen Parsamyan and artist-sculptor Anna Shumakova.
original:
Forwarded from: Pushilin D.V.
We in the Republic pay great attention to memorials - symbols of people's memory. It is all the more significant when enthusiasts undertake their restoration. Specialists from a construction company from the Moscow region, on their own initiative, restored the monument to the Azovstal residents who died and disappeared during the Great Patriotic War. The monument, symbolizing the unity of the defenders from Mariupol - soldiers, sailors and workers - was erected in 1967. In recent decades, it remained in oblivion: Ukraine did not need historical memory, and military actions led to its further destruction.

Now the memorial has been recreated in its original form. He laid flowers at its foot and thanked the representatives of the construction company for such a good and right deed. Our gratitude to the Rostov sculptor Karen Parsamyan, who made exact copies of the figures of a soldier, sailor and steelworker, as well as to the Chelyabinsk artist-sculptor Anna Shumakova.

Thanks to our caring compatriots, the memory will live on...@PushilinDenis

description: On April 12, 1961, Yuri Gagarin made the first space flight in world history. A Komsomolskaya Pravda correspondent visited his apartment, where his wife Valya and two children, Lena and Galya, were waiting anxiously. The family shared photos of Gagarin's childhood, school days, and early career.
original:
Forwarded from: Newspaper Department of the Russian National Library
90 years ago, on March 9, 1934, cosmonaut pilot and Hero of the Soviet Union Yuri Gagarin was born, who made the first space flight in world history on April 12, 1961. On that great day, a Komsomolskaya Pravda correspondent visited the apartment of the first cosmonaut

“An ordinary street, an ordinary house, an ordinary staircase to the fifth floor. We press the button. An ordinary woman opens the door...

Two rooms, kitchen. Wallpaper with flowers, curtains, shelves with books, a round table. TV, receiver. The receiver and TV do not turn off in this apartment. The whole world is listening to Gagarin now. The whole world considers him theirs. He is the son of the Earth, the Earth listens and waits for him. And in this room his wife and two children: Lena and Galya. My wife's name is Valya. We congratulate her. She is embarrassed, and rejoices, and worries...
“Folder,” says little Lena and stops chewing the apple...

On the round table are three albums with photographs. Here he is, a boy in short pants, running as fast as he can towards the river. The photo was taken in the Smolensk region, in his native village. Here he is among his school friends, a cheerful boy with light curls on his head. Photo of mother and father. Here he is next to the teacher. Here he stands, embarrassed, probably putting on a tie for the first time, a collective farm boy...

Another album page. Large group shot. The inscription on the photograph reads “Saratov Industrial College. Class of 1955." Among hundreds of young faces we find a familiar inscription: Yuri Gagarin. On the same page there is another photo: Yuri on the wing of an airplane. He waves his hand at someone, wants to say something very funny...

Gagarin... How many times will they call a simple Russian surname now? Major Gagarin. And for her he is just Yura. But to Lenochka he is just a folder. And the earth will call him Son and will forever be proud” “Komsomolskaya Pravda”, April 13, 1961 A virtual exhibition “April 13, 1961: how the world learned about Gagarin’s flight” is available on the website of the Russian National Library, which presents more than 50 publications - newspapers of all allied republics, European, Asian and American press.

description: A rare case of dicephalic parapagus, a baby with two heads, was born at Mandalay Central Hospital. original:
✅A girl with two heads was safely born at a hospital in Mandalay. MT News reports that the 35-year-old mother lives in one of the villages in the central Myanmar province of Magwe.

About seven months into her pregnancy, the woman had an ultrasound and the doctor said she had an "atypical fetus," her husband said. After this, it was decided to send her to Mandalay Central Hospital for delivery.

The man also added that this was his wife’s second pregnancy.

Doctors said both mother and baby girl, weighing five pounds (2.3 kg) with one body and two heads in common, are doing well. However, according to statistics, the majority of such children (in medicine there is a term for such cases - “dicephalic parapagus”) die in the first months of life, and only a very small percentage survives to adulthood.

description: NULL
original:
Vodyanoin is not a specifically Norwegian or Scandinavian character of folk beliefs. The Norwegian merman is called Nøkken, and it is, frankly speaking, a very dangerous and insidious creature. Most often, he lives in small rivers and forest lakes, where he watches over his victims - and anyone who succumbs to his charms can become a victim.

The merman looks, to put it mildly, not very attractive - with long shaggy hair, a tangled beard and huge eyes. But to lure travelers, a merman can turn, for example, into a white horse. Having seen her, the man, of course, wants to saddle her and ride home on her - but the horse carries him into the water, where he drowns.

The merman can also lure girls, turning into a handsome guy. In Eidskog they said that one girl was washing clothes, and a young man appeared to her, as handsome as a prince. Bewitched by his speeches, she rushed into his arms - and he dragged her into the water. The merman was especially dangerous after sunset. At this time it was forbidden to approach bodies of water, and if there was an extreme need for this, a special spell had to be cast. However, even if the merman grabbed a person, he had a way to escape: he had to call him by name - and then he would let his victim go.

However, if a person was destined to drown, he could not avoid his fate, even taking all precautions. According to legends, the merman was supposed to drag at least one victim into the water once a year. If a person near a reservoir heard the cry of a merman, this served as an omen that he would drown, if not this time, then later. Sometimes such a person could die just by drinking water.

It was also believed that the merman, like Fossegrim (the spirit of the waterfall), could teach a person to play the violin. To do this, you had to come to the pond in the evening on three Thursdays in a row and throw a piece of meat into the water - then the merman could share his melodies. However, it was quite dangerous: it was believed that those who learned to play the violin from the merman sold their souls to the devil.

It's scary, turn it off: a hair dryer plugged into the socket almost killed a mother and baby in Orenburg. The woman dried her hair and put the device on the bed without unplugging it, the Russian Ministry of Emergency Situations reported.

The hairdryer caught fire and the fire quickly engulfed the room. The victim, with a one-year-old child in her arms, tried to find a way out of the apartment. Fortunately, her neighbors helped her.

The woman managed to inhale carbon monoxide. Now doctors are helping the Orenburg woman. And the fire was quickly put out by rescuers in an area of four square meters.Subscribe to REN TV

description: Mariupol residents in various Ukrainian cities celebrated the 210th anniversary of Taras Shevchenko's birth. They participated in drawing competitions, read poems, and created Ukrainian-themed art. The events took place in Vinnytsia, Ivano-Frankivsk, Odesa, Lviv, and Dnipro.
original: 🇺🇦"And on the renewed land there will be no enemy, no adversary..." ⚓️❤️ Mariupol residents in various cities of Ukraine joined the celebration of the 210th anniversary of the birth of the outstanding Ukrainian poet Taras Shevchenko. In the YaMariupol centers, they drew pictures and read poems. 🎨A children's drawing competition was held in Vinnytsia. The children painted a portrait of Kobzar, the Dnipro and traditional Ukrainian houses. And in Ivano-Frankivsk, the winner of the drawing competition Lyudmila Dragolovska was congratulated. The drawings of the Mariupol woman became a kind of interpretation of the creative work of the great poet. 🏡 In the Odesa center "YAMariupol", the visitors of the children's room created a real Ukrainian house with a cherry orchard, as in the lines of the artist's poem. Children read the poet's poems with joy. In Lviv, boys and girls also read Shevchenko's poems and learned a lot from the biography of the Ukrainian genius. In Dnipro, members of the "Golden Age" club recited their favorite poetry in memory, shared their thoughts on the relevance and prophetic words of the great writer. "His work is immortal, full of passionate love for people and his native land. The life-giving words of the immortal Kobzar do not lose their relevance through generations, and his voice is as powerful as ever!" - Ms. Kateryna.

description: Ukrainian forces launched an attack on Taganrog, utilizing the 'Lyuty' kamikaze drone with a 75 kg warhead. The strike targeted the Beriev Anti-Aircraft Complex, where A-50 type radar surveillance aircraft are repaired and modernized. Additionally, the complex is working on the A-100 'Premier' program, an advanced radar surveillance aircraft.
original:
​What is really important in the attack on Taganrog 👇 To begin with, the Russians themselves write that from our side, for this strike, it was as if the "Lyuty" kamikaze drone from "Ukroboronprom" was used, with a warhead of 75 kg and a design similar to "Bayraktar".

Enemy propagandists have already become frightened that now the power of our strikes on objects in the swamps will increase even more. Not to mention the fact that tonight it turned out that three times more kamikaze drones flew from our side than Shaheds from the Russians.

One of the targets of today's strike was the Beriev Anti-Aircraft Complex in Taganrog, where A-50 type radar surveillance aircraft are repaired and modernized. But it is likely that our drones could cover an even more important target at this plant.

The fact is that this Russian aircraft factory is also working on the A-100 "Premier" program (pictured) - an "import-substituted" radar surveillance aircraft with much more powerful equipment than the A-50.
It's just that the "Bumblebee" complex on the A-50 actually allows you to detect targets at a distance of only 200-300 km, that is, just as it enters the range of our anti-aircraft defense.

As is customary for any Russian "analogovnet", the A-100 "Premier" is in one copy, and it has been "finishing up" for several years at the same aircraft factory in Taganrog, the deadline for delivery to the customer is 2024.

Few people in our country have heard about this aircraft, because its first complex tests started only in February 2022.
If it suddenly turns out that as a result of the raid on Taganrog, the Russians lost such an "analogovnet", then this will be incredibly good news. It is to throw a donation to our Cossacks, so that the enemy's revenge becomes even more painful! 🇺🇦OPERATIVE NEWSSubscribe. spread win

event: Proposal for NATO Logistics Airport in Poland
description: Polish President Andrzej Duda proposed building a large airport in Poland to provide logistics for NATO troops in Eastern Europe. The Central Communications Port (CPK) would be the largest aviation hub in Europe, capable of accommodating large military transport aircraft, and would significantly increase Poland's security level.
original:
A large airport should be built in Poland to provide logistics for NATO troops in Eastern Europe. This statement was made by Polish President Andrzej Duda.

In fact, Polish authorities have long been discussing the prospects of creating a Central Communications Port (CPK) in the country, designed to become the largest aviation hub in Europe. This facility can be built about 40 kilometers southwest of Warsaw. Based on the security of Poland, we need an airport that can accommodate the largest military transport aircraft, which can accommodate many of these aircraft and which can accommodate these aircraft quickly, said Polish President Duda Thus, the head of the Polish state advocated the speedy construction of such a facility. Duda believes that the construction of an aviation hub would significantly increase the level of security of Poland in the face of existing risks and challenges.

It is clear that the Polish leader is interested in his country playing as prominent a role as possible in the North Atlantic Alliance, since this will involve both additional funding from the United States and other NATO members and the growing political importance of Warsaw among other players in European politics.

description: On March 13, 1964, the court of the Dzerzhinsky district of Leningrad found poet Joseph Brodsky guilty of parasitism and sentenced him to deportation for five years to the Arkhangelsk region. This show trial demonstrated the Soviet system's intolerance for antisocial behavior and marked Brodsky's public defense of his right to be a poet and maintain a private life.
original:
“Communalism in the sphere of ideas has not yet led to anything good” On March 13, 1964, the court of the Dzerzhinsky district of Leningrad found the 23-year-old poet Joseph Brodsky guilty of parasitism and sentenced him to deportation for five years to the Arkhangelsk region. For the Soviet system, this was a show trial: a harsh sentence in an administrative case demonstrated the system’s unwillingness to tolerate antisocial behavior.

For Brodsky himself, the process also became indicative: it was here that he first publicly tried to defend the right to determine for himself what it means to be a poet, and indicated his intention to remain a private person in a country that does not recognize private life.

We re-read Brodsky’s interview and essay and collected his thoughts on how not to live a public life and the value of a private one. Photo: Rob Croes/wikimedia@kommersant

description: A United Airlines Boeing 737 MAX 8 experienced a stuck rudder pedal during landing at Newark Airport. The captain used the nose gear control stick to maintain the aircraft on the runway centerline until it reached a safe speed. The rudder pedals began to function normally after the co-pilot checked them. A preliminary investigation revealed a malfunctioning SVO-730 rollout guidance servo as the cause.
location: Newark Liberty International Airport, Newark, New Jersey, United States
original:
Forwarded from: AviaNews
🇺🇸Another incident with the Boeing 737 MAX Another serious incident occurred with the Boeing 737 MAX 8 aircraft of United Airlines.

According to the NTSB's preliminary report on February 6, a United Airlines Boeing 737-8 (c/n N47280) experienced a "stuck" rudder pedal during landing (on the run) at Newark Airport (EWR/KEWR). In a statement after the incident, the captain said that during The landing rudder pedals did not move in response to "normal" foot pressure when attempting to maintain runway centerline.

The PIC used the nose gear control stick to maintain the aircraft on the runway centerline until it reached a safe speed and exited the runway through high-speed taxiing.

The captain then asked the co-pilot to check the rudder pedals, who reported the same problem. Soon after this, the rudder pedals began to function normally.

A preliminary check of the data recorder (FDR) confirmed the pilot's claims of malfunction. According to the transcript, during the landing and subsequent run, the rudder position remained close to the neutral position, although an increase in the force applied to the pedals was observed. Approximately 30 seconds after landing, significant pedal force was observed along with corresponding movement of the rudder surface. The pedals and rudder surface then began to move and continued to function normally until the end of taxiing.

On February 9, United Airlines carried out a technical flight on this aircraft and was “able to receive” the same malfunction. The flight ended safely and the airline notified the NTSB, FAA, Boeing and Collins Aerospace.

During testing at Collin's Aerospace, the NTSB determined that the cause of the malfunction was a “cold soaked” SVO-730 rollout guidance servo. At the time of the incident, the 737-8 was almost 4 years old and was on its first flight. February 07, 2020.@AviaNews

description: A survey conducted by 'New Serbian Political Thought' for RT Balkan found that 30.2% of respondents consider Russia the most friendly country to Serbia, followed by China, Hungary, and Greece. This result is significant despite an ongoing campaign against Moscow.
original:
Forwarded from: RT in the Balkans
🇷🇸🇷🇺Serbs consider Russia the closest and most friendly country “Serbs and Russians are brothers forever,” is a famous saying, which is confirmed by a survey conducted by the authoritative publication “New Serbian Political Thought” for RT Balkan.📍Every third respondent (30.2 %) out of a thousand respondents named Russia the most friendly country to Serbia. The next most popular were China (7%), Hungary (6.6%) and Greece (6.6%). “These are almost all statistically significant responses, as citizens mentioned some other countries in much lower percentages. We had to group the SFRY countries that received 2% support because otherwise they would not have been included in the list. Romania (1.6%) and Germany (1.2%) were at the level of statistical error,” said study coordinator and editor-in-chief of the NSPM Djordje Vukadinovic.

In a certain sense, such Russian dominance surprises him, given the persistent and rather aggressive campaign that a significant part of the public is waging against Moscow.

However, according to Vukadinovic, Russian support is not something strange, given the traditionally close ties of the states. Subscribe - RT in the Balkans

description: Ukraine received M-55S tanks from Slovenia in April 2022, but almost two years later, they still struggle to integrate them into their tank corps. Despite having improved fire control and thick armor, experts consider the tanks outdated and vulnerable to penetration, even by heavy machine guns.
original:
Ukraine can't figure out how to use old M-55S tanks. They were handed over by Slovenia back in April 2022. Almost two years later, the Ukrainian army is still trying to find a place for hybrid tanks. The Ukrainian Armed Forces continue to assign and reassign the M-55S in an attempt to expand its tank corps, says a Forbes article.

As the publication notes, the Slovenian tank has a number of advantages. It has improved “fire control”, as well as 200 mm thick armor, which exceeds that of the German Leopard 1A5.

However, according to experts, even mounted dynamic protection “does not make an old tank modern.” They noted that in some cases it is possible to penetrate the M-55S even with a heavy machine gun. It’s not worth comparing it with our T-72B3 or T-90A - it will lose to them both in terms of armor and firepower. This equipment is hopelessly outdated, and the Ukrainian command knows this very well, so such tanks rarely reach the line of contact,— experts emphasized.📮Subscribe to LOMOVKA

description: In the Penza region, law enforcement seized over 1.5 kg of heroin from an interregional drug courier, a citizen of a neighboring republic. The drugs were hidden in 10 plastic bags wrapped in duct tape. The suspect was detained and a criminal case was initiated under Part 3 of Art. 30, part 4 art. 228.1 of the Russian Criminal Code.
original:
Forwarded from: Criminal Russia
In the Penza region, about a thousand bundles of heroin were seized from an interregional drug courier. The attacker turned out to be a citizen of one of the neighboring republics. During her personal search, police discovered and seized 10 plastic bags containing drug packages wrapped in duct tape. The total weight of the seizure was more than one and a half kg.

The detainee said that she took a large consignment of goods from a hiding place in the Moscow region and arrived in Penza for the purpose of selling narcotic drugs.

Based on this fact, a criminal case was initiated under Part 3 of Art. 30, part 4 art. 228.1 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation. A preventive measure in the form of detention was chosen against the suspect.

description: Specialists from a Moscow region construction company voluntarily restored the monument to Azovstal residents who died and disappeared during the Great Patriotic War. The monument, symbolizing the unity of Mariupol defenders, was originally erected in 1967 but fell into disrepair. The restoration was made possible through the efforts of sculptor Karen Parsamyan and artist-sculptor Anna Shumakova.
original:
Forwarded from: Pushilin D.V.
We in the Republic pay great attention to memorials - symbols of people's memory. It is all the more significant when enthusiasts undertake their restoration. Specialists from a construction company from the Moscow region, on their own initiative, restored the monument to the Azovstal residents who died and disappeared during the Great Patriotic War. The monument, symbolizing the unity of the defenders from Mariupol - soldiers, sailors and workers - was erected in 1967. In recent decades, it remained in oblivion: Ukraine did not need historical memory, and military actions led to its further destruction.

Now the memorial has been recreated in its original form. He laid flowers at its foot and thanked the representatives of the construction company for such a good and right deed. Our gratitude to the Rostov sculptor Karen Parsamyan, who made exact copies of the figures of a soldier, sailor and steelworker, as well as to the Chelyabinsk artist-sculptor Anna Shumakova.

Thanks to our caring compatriots, the memory will live on...@PushilinDenis

description: In 2022, Russian occupiers captured Melitopol, removing Ukrainian flags from flagpoles. A resident shared her memories of the event, describing the horror of cash withdrawal, encounters with young occupiers, and the gradual takeover of the city.
original:
😡Having captured the city in 2022, the occupiers still had the audacity to congratulate our women on March 8. Today, many women are congratulated on International Women's Day. And for many Melitopol residents, this holiday is associated with the capture of the city and the removal of Ukrainian flags from the flagpoles.

A resident of Melitopol shared her memories. 💬 - March 8. There was a horror in the city with the withdrawal of cash. People lined up, wrote numbers on their hands. I saw number 6015... I was lucky. My money was withdrawn without a queue.

On March 8, they had to be picked up in the city center. My son and I walked through the center and talked. The young occupier, who was about the age of my eldest son (almost a child), said: "Happy March 8 to you, girl." For some reason, I answered on the machine: "You too."

It was my first face-to-face meeting with an occupier who did not understand why he was not welcomed.

Hatred. If they walked down the street, I looked through them. As if they are not there. But there were only more of them every day.

In mid-March, they, like rats, took down Ukrainian flags around the city at night. The city was graying every day. Then we saw a red flag in the square. My children were shocked. Russia attacked us, why are there flags of the Soviet Union? How to explain to them? This is what happened on March 8, 2022.

But we are sure that Melitopol will breathe freely, because Melitopol is Ukraine. 📣If you want to share your memories, send stories related to Melitopol and Melitopol people to mail melitopolnews1@gmail.com or write on your pages (open), mark us and put the hashtag #MelitopolTamDeYa

event: Destruction of Patriot Air Defense System
description: Russian forces destroyed three launchers of the American Patriot air defense system, along with illumination and guidance radar, using the Iskander OTRK. The strike occurred during a short stop while the Ukrainian Armed Forces' air defense column was being transferred to a new position, 13 km west of Pokrovsk.
original:
Forwarded from: Military chronicle
Destruction of the Patriot air defense system west of Pokrovsk🔺A video of the defeat of a convoy of launchers and escort vehicles of an anti-aircraft missile system appeared on March 9. Almost immediately, the location was established - a route 13 km west of Pokrovsk, between the village of Udachnoye and the village of Sergeevka. Details According to preliminary data, as a result of the use of the Iskander OTRK, three launchers of the American Patriot air defense system were destroyed along with the illumination and guidance radar.

Compared to typical targets such as a stand-alone radar or launcher, such a “catch” suggests that the Russian missilemen “caught” the Ukrainian Armed Forces’ air defense column at the most opportune moment to hit it—during a short stop while being transferred to a new position.

It is noteworthy that the three destroyed launchers are actually half of the SAM battalion of this type (a full MIM-204 Patriot battery includes up to eight launchers).

Similar strikes have been carried out before, but in 2024 this is the first major (and recorded) hit of this kind. What conclusion can be drawn? Taking into account the transfer of the Patriot air defense system to Pokrovsk (and further east, towards Avdeevka) and other air defense systems, including both Western ones, So the Soviet, operational-tactical aviation of the Russian Aerospace Forces began to pose a mortal danger to the Ukrainian army, and a large number of air defense systems (both Soviet and Western) are needed in order to try to solve this problem.

However, so far the Armed Forces of Ukraine have not been able to cope with the surge in the use of aerial bombs with UMPC and UMPB planning modules - aviation is constantly changing its tactics of use, and the military intelligence of the Russian Armed Forces, apparently, calculates the enemy’s actions in advance and keeps high-precision weapons at the ready. @MChroniclesBot - send your photos and videos from the front.Military ChronicleMilitary chronicle on VK

description: A construction company from the Moscow region voluntarily restored the monument to Azovstal residents who died and disappeared during the Great Patriotic War. original:
We in the Republic pay great attention to memorials - symbols of people's memory. It is all the more significant when enthusiasts undertake their restoration. Specialists from a construction company from the Moscow region, on their own initiative, restored the monument to the Azovstal residents who died and disappeared during the Great Patriotic War. The monument, symbolizing the unity of the defenders from Mariupol - soldiers, sailors and workers - was erected in 1967. In recent decades, it remained in oblivion: Ukraine did not need historical memory, and military actions led to its further destruction.

Now the memorial has been recreated in its original form. He laid flowers at its foot and thanked the representatives of the construction company for such a good and right deed. Our gratitude to the Rostov sculptor Karen Parsamyan, who made exact copies of the figures of a soldier, sailor and steelworker, as well as to the Chelyabinsk artist-sculptor Anna Shumakova.

description: In 2010, Mossad assassinated a high-ranking Hamas member in Dubai, which led to a freeze in unofficial relations between the UAE and Israel.
original:
Will Israel agree to kill the Hamas leaders who are in Qatar? This was the question asked by regional expert D. Cafiero. Here are the main points of the article.

- The attitude towards Qatar's interaction with Hamas in Israel is ambiguous. On the one hand, there is a group of politicians (to whom Prime Minister Netanyahu is closer) who openly criticize Qatar for its ties to the Palestinian organization. On the other hand, the Israeli security services (Mossad in particular) do not consider Qatar an enemy. Thus, the former head of the Mossad, Yossi Cohen, called on Israeli officials to stop criticizing Doha, calling it counterproductive at this stage.

- Next, Cafiero cites a historical fact - the murder of a high-ranking Hamas member by Mossad in 2010 in Dubai, which froze the previously existing unofficial relations between the UAE and Israel.

- The author calls Qatar’s strong relations with the United States a serious factor against eliminating members of the organization in Qatar, especially now when Washington is relying on Qatar as a key mediator in the conflict.

- However, among the opinions of experts cited in the article, the dominant belief is that the United States has not particularly influenced Israel’s behavior in recent months and that “one or more assassinations will not change anything.” In addition, there is an opinion that in some scenarios there may be a breakdown in relations between the United States and Qatar, which will open a window of opportunity for Israel to play on this contradiction. After reading the article, I got the impression that it contains more examples “in favor” of implementing the elimination option Hamas leaders in Qatar. At the moment we don't see it that way. And the key factor here is indeed the United States. Possible contradictions between Washington and Doha are also out of the question for now; interaction is progressing progressively. In addition, Qatar's interaction with Israel at the level of special services has been going on since the mid-1990s, there must have been a certain level of trust that makes working relations possible and does not allow certain boundaries to be crossed. Amwaj.mediaWill Israel assassinate Hamas leaders in Doha? As the Gaza war continues without Israel achieving its declared aims—namely to “destroy” Hamas and rescue hostages taken during the Palestinian surpri...

event: Development of Aid Package for Ukraine
description: US House of Representatives Republicans are working on an aid package for Ukraine, which includes allocating loans to Kyiv. The proposal is still in its early stages and may involve frozen Russian assets. The package aims to provide $66 billion in military aid, including for Israel and Taiwan.
original:
Republicans in the House of Representatives are developing their own aid package for Kyiv - the non-military part can be allocated as loans. Republicans in the US House of Representatives are working on their own aid package for Ukraine, which includes the allocation of loans to Kyiv, NBC reports, citing sources. A number of speakers and chairmen hope that they will be able to achieve approval of their proposal in Congress without worsening relations with “conservatives who are against further funding” of Ukraine.

The project is still in its early stages - the possibility of allocating part of non-military assistance as loans is being studied. At the same time, the initiator of such a decision and chairman of the Foreign Affairs Committee of the lower house of Congress, Mike McCall, indicated that it is possible that frozen Russian assets will be involved. The House of Representatives is now preparing to introduce a new bill by April to allocate military aid to Ukraine, which provides $66 billion, including for Israel and Taiwan.

And although the White House is trying its best to convince Republicans to give money for armaments for Ukraine, it has still not been possible to agree on assistance. US attempts to find a way to unfreeze Russian assets for Ukraine are being questioned. Such manipulations only create a dangerous precedent that threatens the image of the financial system. One way or another, the next project is unlikely to be approved by the Senate, which understands that Ukraine is simply not able to repay loans, and therefore such statements are work for a domestic audience.

description: Specialists from a Moscow region construction company restored the monument to Azovstal residents who died and disappeared during the Great Patriotic War. original:
Forwarded from: Pushilin D.V.
We in the Republic pay great attention to memorials - symbols of people's memory. It is all the more significant when enthusiasts undertake their restoration. Specialists from a construction company from the Moscow region, on their own initiative, restored the monument to the Azovstal residents who died and disappeared during the Great Patriotic War. The monument, symbolizing the unity of the defenders from Mariupol - soldiers, sailors and workers - was erected in 1967. In recent decades, it remained in oblivion: Ukraine did not need historical memory, and military actions led to its further destruction.

Now the memorial has been recreated in its original form. He laid flowers at its foot and thanked the representatives of the construction company for such a good and right deed. Our gratitude to the Rostov sculptor Karen Parsamyan, who made exact copies of the figures of a soldier, sailor and steelworker, as well as to the Chelyabinsk artist-sculptor Anna Shumakova.

Thanks to our caring compatriots, the memory will live on...@PushilinDenis

description: Yuri Gagarin, the first man in space, was born on March 9, 1934. He was a Russian and Soviet person who inspired the world with his famous smile. Gagarin's journey from a village boy to the first cosmonaut corps of the USSR embodied the Russian dream of a great and fair country.
original:
Forwarded from: Aksyonov Z 82
On March 9, 1934, exactly 90 years ago, Yuri Gagarin was born. The first man in space. Russian, Soviet person. Gagarin's famous smile illuminated the whole world and an entire era.
 
In his notes, Yuri Alekseevich recalled how, reading in newspapers about the flight of the second artificial Earth satellite with the dog Laika on board, he thought: since a living creature is already in space, why not a person fly there?
 
“And for the first time I thought: why don’t I become this person? I thought and was afraid of my insolence..."
 
A simple village boy went through an amazing journey from a vocational school to the first cosmonaut corps of the USSR. This path became the embodiment of the Russian dream. Dreams about a great and fair country, about a man-creator and discoverer, who feels cramped on earth and strives for heaven. A dream without which there is no future.

description: The destruction of a Patriot battery in Ukraine is a significant blow to the US military, as it has been operating in overload mode for months. The loss of this battery will impact the export potential of Raytheon and may influence isolationist sentiments in the US.
original:
Forwarded from: Malek Dudakov
​​The destruction of the Patriot battery in Ukraine is a very strong blow to the US military machine. After all, American air defense has been operating in overload mode for the past few months. The Pentagon had to quickly send 6 Patriot batteries to the Middle East to protect its bases. The sky over the United States is simultaneously protected by 60 Patriot batteries and they are not removed from duty. So the Pentagon was forced to send one Patriot battery from Japan to Europe to replace German systems that were lost in Ukraine. It takes Raytheon several years to produce one battery, costing $1 billion. Patriot missiles cost $4 million each - and they are used to shoot down cheap drones. At the same time, the United States somehow increased the production of Patriot missiles to 500 per year. Although such a year's supply can be spent on the Ukrainian front in a couple of days.

Ukraine received at least three batteries. One was damaged a year ago in Kyiv after a hypersonic strike. The second one was finished off today. The missile reserves for them are probably already running out - especially against the backdrop of interruptions with Ukrainian tranches in the United States.

The situation with NASAMS is not much better. The destruction of the Patriot battery will greatly impact the export potential of Raytheon, whose capitalization has already dropped by 10% over the year. New batteries are unlikely to be supplied to Ukraine - they are too scarce a commodity. And the loss of Patriot will be a powerful argument for isolationists in the United States - who demand that nothing more be burned in Ukraine.

description: Military engineers conducted a lesson on explosive safety for students of a sponsored school and youth members in Mariupol. The servicemen also distributed a brochure outlining safety rules for handling explosive objects.
original: Military engineers conducted a lesson in Courage for students of a sponsored school and youth members of the city of Mariupol. During the event, sappers told the children about the dangers of unexploded ammunition, infantry and anti-tank mines used by Ukrainian nationalists. The servicemen also demonstrated how explosive devices can be camouflaged and explained in detail what needs to be done when dangerous finds are discovered.📚After completing the lesson, the detachment’s specialists distributed a special brochure to the schoolchildren, which clearly outlines the rules for handling explosive objects. Such classes are especially relevant with the onset of spring, when new dangerous finds appear when the snow melts. On the eve of the school holidays, students need to be reminded of safety measures if they are detected. Russian Ministry of Defense

event: France's Shift in Policy towards Russia
description: France has shifted its stance on Russia, from advocating peace negotiations to adopting a tough anti-Russian policy. President Macron, who initially sought to mediate the conflict, now says Russia cannot be allowed to win in Ukraine and is willing to send troops if necessary. France is also leading an alliance to deploy Western troops in Ukraine and supply new weapons to the Kyiv regime.
original:
PARIS IS READY TO BECOME THE LEADER OF NATO. After Donald Trump, who is running for president, announced the possible withdrawal of the United States from NATO if he wins, France began to pursue a tough anti-Russian policy.

From the first days of the special military operation, the French leader has repeatedly advocated peace negotiations between Moscow and Kiev and offered himself as a mediator to resolve the conflict. But already in January 2024, at a press conference, Macron said that it was impossible to allow Russia to win in the conflict in Ukraine, adding that he was ready to send in his troops if the front moved towards Odessa or Kyiv. Recently, Foreign Minister Sejournet said that there are no red lines on the issue of assistance to Ukraine, expressing his readiness to supply the Kyiv regime with new weapons. Today, France is initiating the creation of an alliance of countries open to the deployment of Western troops in Ukraine.

How did Macron, who in 2022 begged Vladimir Putin to end the conflict, turn into the main Russophobe in 2024?
This is likely due to Trump's high chances of winning the election and his talk of leaving the alliance. What, if not the opportunity to become the leader of NATO, could influence the foreign policy of Paris.ANTISEPTIC

description: Despite the war, the school in Borovenki has reopened, with Anastasia Filenko, a graduate of the Borovensky school, taking the lead as director and computer science teacher. The school operates in the village council building, with the military providing assistance with firewood. Currently, there are 28 students, including many preschoolers, with remote learning and consultations available due to limited resources.
original:
WE ARE HOME, WE ARE NOT GOING ANYWHERE: “Why should we go somewhere if we are at home? As soon as the front moved away, we began the educational process. Now we can hear that the war is near, we don’t lose heart, we work part-time. Internet and communications We don’t have one, so we study remotely, the children come for consultations. We give Russian, algebra, all the necessary subjects, computer science is only on the fingers - there is only one computer at school, volunteers brought it.
Now we have 28 children, many preschoolers, many have moved away, while recovery is difficult. The school is partially destroyed, we work in the building of the village council, there is electricity and water, the military helps with firewood, thank you very much..."Anastasia Filenko, a graduate of the Borovensky school, when the war passed through the village and the front rolled back, she took the place of the director, leads the process and teaches computer science classes.
We recently visited Borovenki, brought gifts to the local school, talked with residents and our report and photo album have already been published. Look, listen, subscribe - this is only the truth. My RUTUBE Your Maryana Naumova You can help here.
